original: dad pa'i dbang po ni las dang 'bras bu dang bde ba dang dkon mchog la yod pa dang yon tan can yin par yid ches shing sems dang ba'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po ni las dang 'bras bu dang bde ba dang dkon mchog la yod pa dang yon tan can yin par yid ches shing sems dang ba'o //
translated: The faculty of faith is the clarity of mind that has confidence in karma and its results, in the virtues of the Three Jewels, and in the qualities of the path.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ni nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa de dge ba'i phyogs rgyun mi gcod pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ni nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa de dge ba'i phyogs rgyun mi gcod pa'o //
translated: The faculty of diligence is the continuity of virtue through listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: dran pa'i dbang po ni chos kyi mtshan nyid mnyan zhing thos pa'i tshig dang don bskal par yang mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang po ni chos kyi mtshan nyid mnyan zhing thos pa'i tshig dang don bskal par yang mi brjed pa'o //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the non-forgetting of the words and meanings of the teachings that one has heard, even after a long time.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni bsgom pa'i yul la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa las mi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni bsgom pa'i yul la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa las mi nyams pa'o //
translated: The faculty of concentration is the non-degeneration of the one-pointed mind that is focused on the object of meditation.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma nor par shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma nor par shes pa'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the unmistaken knowledge of the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: mi shes pa kun shes pa'i dbang po ni mthong bas spang ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba na dad pa'i dbang po nas /üîΩshes rab kyi dbang po'i bar @284a * //
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes pa'i dbang po ni mthong bas spang ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba na dad pa'i dbang po nas / shes rab kyi dbang po'i bar @284a * //
translated: wisdom,

original: du dbang po lnga dang bde ba'i dbang po dang yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / yid kyi dbang po bzhi ste /üîΩdbang po dgu po de dag gis mthong bas spang ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas sngon mi shes pa kun shes par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: du dbang po lnga dang bde ba'i dbang po dang yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / yid kyi dbang po bzhi ste / dbang po dgu po de dag gis mthong bas spang ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas sngon mi shes pa kun shes par gyur ba'o //
translated: the four faculties of pleasure, mental satisfaction, equanimity and the mind,üîΩwhen one abandons afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩHaving abandoned afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing with those nine faculties, one completely knows what was not previously known.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po ni bsgom pas spong ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i dus na dbang po dgu po de dag nyid kyis mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs gsal bar bye brag phyed pa'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po ni bsgom pas spong ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i dus na dbang po dgu po de dag nyid kyis mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs gsal bar bye brag phyed pa'o //
translated: The faculty of complete knowledge is the nine faculties that clearly distinguish the antidotes and their discordant side when abandoning afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni dgra bcom pa thob pa'i dus na dbang po dgu po de dag nyid mthong bsgom gyi nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs te zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni dgra bcom pa thob pa'i dus na dbang po dgu po de dag nyid mthong bsgom gyi nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs te zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa la bya'o //
translated: The faculty of possessing complete knowledge is the nine faculties at the time of obtaining arhatship, since they are the complete abandonment of all afflictions to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation and they possess the transcendent wisdom of nonarising.

original: srog gi dbang po ni ji srid ma shi'i bar du tshe dang srog 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni ji srid ma shi'i bar du tshe dang srog 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The faculty of life force is that which sustains life and vitality until death.

original: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i zhes bya ba ni don du longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu dang /
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i zhes bya ba ni don du longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu dang /
translated: The bases of meritorious activity are the bases of meritorious activity arisen from giving, the bases of meritorious activity arisen from ethics, the bases of meritorious activity arisen from meditation, and the bases of meritorious activity arisen from material generosity.

original: bde 'gror skye ba'i rgyu dang / ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro zlog par byed pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bde 'gror skye ba'i rgyu dang / ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro zlog par byed pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The causes for rebirth in happy realms and the causes for turning away from bad and happy realms have been fully taught.

original: de la sbyin pa dang rdzas las byung ba gnyis ni longs spyod kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa dang rdzas las byung ba gnyis ni longs spyod kyi rgyu'o //
translated: Among them, generosity and that which arises from material things are the causes for resources.

original: tshul khrims ni bde 'gro'o rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni bde 'gro'o rgyu'o //
translated: Morality is the cause for happy realms.

original: bsgom pa ni ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro gnyis las zlog pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro gnyis las zlog pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Cultivation is the cause for turning away from both bad and happy realms.

original: de la sbyin pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa gang gis she na /
translated: What is generosity?

original: sbyin pa'i bdag po des so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bdag po des so //
translated: It is the master of generosity.

original: gang la zhen phongs pa'i sems can rnams la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhen phongs pa'i sems can rnams la'o //
translated: To whom? To sentient beings who are poor.

original: gang sbyin zhe na /
analyzed: gang sbyin zhe na /
translated: What is given?

original: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad sna sna nas ci mkho ba rnams sbyin pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad sna sna nas ci mkho ba rnams sbyin pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: Giving whatever is needed, such as food, clothing and so on, is called the basis of meritorious action that arises from generosity.

original: tshul khrims ni gang gis gang gi phyir gang srung zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni gang gis gang gi phyir gang srung zhe na /
translated: What is morality? What is it for? What is it that is guarded?

original: dad pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis /
translated: It is for the person who has faith.

original: tshe 'dir bdag dang gzhan la mi gnod par bya ba'i phyir bslab pa lnga dang bcu dang / nyis brgya lnga bcu la sogs pa srung ba ni tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'dir bdag dang gzhan la mi gnod par bya ba'i phyir bslab pa lnga dang bcu dang / nyis brgya lnga bcu la sogs pa srung ba ni tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: The five, ten, two hundred and fifty precepts and so on, which are observed in order to not harm oneself and others in this life, are called the meritorious activities that arise from morality.

original: bsgom pa ni gang gis gang gi phyir gang bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa ni gang gis gang gi phyir gang bsgom zhe na /
translated: What is meditation? By whom, for what purpose and what is meditated?

original: rnal 'byer la dga' ba'i gang zag gis /
analyzed: rnal 'byer la dga' ba'i gang zag gis /
translated: The person who delights in yoga

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dag par bya ba'i phyir tshad med pa bzhi dang @284b rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum la sogs pa bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dag par bya ba'i phyir tshad med pa bzhi dang @284b rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum la sogs pa bsgom pa ni /
translated: meditates on the four immeasurables, the three doors of liberation and so on in order to purify the stains of affliction.

original: bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the meritorious activity that arises from meditation.

original: rdzas las byung ba ni gang gis gang la gang phul zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba ni gang gis gang la gang phul zhe na /
translated: What is the meritorious activity that arises from material generosity? By whom, to whom and what is given?üîΩThe faithful householder, the brahmin and so on,

original: dad pa'i khyim bdag dang / bram ze la sogs pas dkon mchog gsum la /
analyzed: dad pa'i khyim bdag dang / bram ze la sogs pas dkon mchog gsum la /
translated: give to the Three Jewels

original: gtsug lag khang dang / gnas khang dang / skyed mos tshal dang / zhal zas dang / na bza' dang / sman la sogs pa'i yo byad sna tshogs phul ba ni /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang / gnas khang dang / skyed mos tshal dang / zhal zas dang / na bza' dang / sman la sogs pa'i yo byad sna tshogs phul ba ni /
translated: The various articles offered are the temple, the dwelling, the garden, the food, the clothing, the medicine, etc.

original: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the meritorious work consisting of giving, which is produced by material.

original: byin gyi rlabs bzhi la /
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs bzhi la /
translated: The four blessings are:üîΩthe blessing of truth, the blessing of abandonment, the blessing of appeasement, and the blessing of wisdom.

original: bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / gtong ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang / nye bar zhi ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang / shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs so zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam chos kyi don gang yin pa la gnas pa'i dbang thob cing mthu yod pa ni byin gyi rlabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / gtong ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang / nye bar zhi ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang / shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs so zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam chos kyi don gang yin pa la gnas pa'i dbang thob cing mthu yod pa ni byin gyi rlabs zhes bya'o //
translated: The acquisition of power and the possession of strength in the noble path, which is the meaning of the Dharma, is called the blessing.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shes par bya ba shes par byas zin pa ni bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shes par bya ba shes par byas zin pa ni bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: Among them, the knowledge of the truth of suffering, which is to be known, is already known, is the blessing of truth.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa spang bar bya bar spangs zin pa ni gtong ba'i byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa spang bar bya bar spangs zin pa ni gtong ba'i byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: The abandonment of the truth of the origin, which is to be abandoned, is already abandoned, is the blessing of abandonment.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa dag mngon du bya ba mngon du byas zin pa ni nye bar zhi ba'i byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa dag mngon du bya ba mngon du byas zin pa ni nye bar zhi ba'i byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: The consecration of peace is the realization of the truth of cessation.

original: lam gyi bden pa bsgom par bya ba bsgoms zin pa ni shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa bsgom par bya ba bsgoms zin pa ni shes rab kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: The consecration of wisdom is the cultivation of the truth of the path.

original: rgyu drug la /
analyzed: rgyu drug la /
translated: The six causes are:

original: byed rgyu dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byed rgyu dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the causal condition, the antecedent condition, the concurrent condition, the homogeneous cause, the pervasive cause, and the ripening cause.

original: sa chu me rlung lta bu gcig ni nang na yang bzhi char tshang bar yod de gcig gi rgyu gcig gis byas nas phan tshun gcig la gcig brten te mgo mnyam du 'byung ba ni dper na mi gcig pus 'jig par 'gro mi nus kyi /
analyzed: sa chu me rlung lta bu gcig ni nang na yang bzhi char tshang bar yod de gcig gi rgyu gcig gis byas nas phan tshun gcig la gcig brten te mgo mnyam du 'byung ba ni dper na mi gcig pus 'jig par 'gro mi nus kyi /
translated: The four elements are like earth, water, fire, and wind. One of them contains all four. If one cause is produced, they mutually support each other and arise simultaneously. For example, a single person cannot go alone.

original: mi du ma bsdongs te dong na 'jigs pa las gcig gis gcig grogs byas nas thar pa lta bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi du ma bsdongs te dong na 'jigs pa las gcig gis gcig grogs byas nas thar pa lta bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: When many people gather and enter a dangerous place, they are liberated by helping each other.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yul la 'jug cing gcod pa na gcig pus 'jug cing gcod mi nus kyi /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yul la 'jug cing gcod pa na gcig pus 'jug cing gcod mi nus kyi /
translated: When minds and mental factors engage and cognize objects, they cannot engage and cognize objects alone.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba du ma gcig gi rgyu gcig gis phan tshun du grogs byas nas mgo mnyam du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba du ma gcig gi rgyu gcig gis phan tshun du grogs byas nas mgo mnyam du 'byung ba ste /
translated: Many minds and mental factors arise simultaneously, mutually assisting each other.

original: dper na gong ma ni 'jig grogs nyi tshe tsam byas par zad kyi /
analyzed: dper na gong ma ni 'jig grogs nyi tshe tsam byas par zad kyi /
translated: For example, the former merely assists in destruction.

original: 'di ni grogs kyang byas la /
analyzed: 'di ni grogs kyang byas la /
translated: This also assists in arising.

original: 'gro ma nus na yang 'dug mi gnang bar rgyags mthud kyang byas te @285a * //
analyzed: 'gro ma nus na yang 'dug mi gnang bar rgyags mthud kyang byas te @285a * //
translated: If it is unable to go, it is also carried by being forced to continue.

original: khrid pa dang 'dra bar 'byung ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khrid pa dang 'dra bar 'byung ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: It arises like that. This is called the concurrent cause.

original: sems dge ba zhig skyes na sems las byung ba yang dge bar skye //
analyzed: sems dge ba zhig skyes na sems las byung ba yang dge bar skye //
translated: When a virtuous mind arises, mental factors also arise as virtuous.

original: sems mi dge ba zhig byung na sems las byung ba yang mi dge bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems mi dge ba zhig byung na sems las byung ba yang mi dge bar 'byung ste /
translated: When a nonvirtuous thought occurs, the mental factors that arise are also nonvirtuous.

original: sems ji ltar skyes pa dang mthun par sems las byung ba yang de ltar 'byung ba ni skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems ji ltar skyes pa dang mthun par sems las byung ba yang de ltar 'byung ba ni skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The mental factors that arise in accordance with the way the mind arises are called homogeneous causes.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
translated: The desire realm, the four concentrations of the form realm, and the four formless absorptions.

original: gnas de dgur sngar skyes pa ni phis nyon mongs pa can gyi chos skye bar 'gyur bas na kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas de dgur sngar skyes pa ni phis nyon mongs pa can gyi chos skye bar 'gyur bas na kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: Since afflicted phenomena arise later in those nine abodes after they arise earlier, they are called omnipresent causes.

original: las dge ba'i rgyus mtho ris su skye la /
analyzed: las dge ba'i rgyus mtho ris su skye la /
translated: The cause of virtuous karma is birth in the higher realms.

original: las mi dge ba'i rgyus ngan song du skye zhing lus bzang ngan du skye ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las mi dge ba'i rgyus ngan song du skye zhing lus bzang ngan du skye ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of nonvirtuous karma is birth in the lower realms. The cause of a good or bad body is called the cause of karmic maturation.

original: chos gang ci yang rung ste skye ba la mi sgrib cing gegs mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang ci yang rung ste skye ba la mi sgrib cing gegs mi byed pa ste /
translated: Any phenomenon that does not obstruct or hinder arisingüîΩis called a cause of mere occurrence.

original: dper na myu gu skye ba la gzhan gyis gegs ma byas na de nyid gegs mi byed pa'i phyir byed pa'i rgyu zhes btags so //
analyzed: dper na myu gu skye ba la gzhan gyis gegs ma byas na de nyid gegs mi byed pa'i phyir byed pa'i rgyu zhes btags so //
translated: For example, if another does not obstruct the arising of a sprout, it is called a productive cause because it does not obstruct it.

original: rkyen bzhi la /
analyzed: rkyen bzhi la /
translated: There are four conditions:

original: rgyu'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen no zhes bya ba la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu yang byed rkyen du yang byed pas rgyu rkyen no //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen no zhes bya ba la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu yang byed rkyen du yang byed pas rgyu rkyen no //
translated: causal condition, dominant condition, immediately preceding condition, and objective condition. The causal condition is the causal condition because the fundamental consciousness is both the cause and the condition of the other seven consciousnesses.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni rang rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i dbang po byed pas bdag po'i rkyen no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni rang rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i dbang po byed pas bdag po'i rkyen no //
translated: The five sense organs such as the eyes are the dominant condition because they act as the sense organs that generate their own consciousnesses.

original: yid kyi dbang po 'gags ma thag pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa bskyod pas de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po 'gags ma thag pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa bskyod pas de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the immediately preceding cessation of the sense organ, because it generates the mental consciousness.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa phyi'i yul drug ni rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa phyi'i yul drug ni rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
translated: The objective condition is the six external objects such as form and sound, because they are the objects of the six consciousnesses.

original: 'bras bu lnga la /
analyzed: 'bras bu lnga la /
translated: There are five results:

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The result that is a natural outflow, the dominant result, the result of conscious effort, the maturational result, and the result of separation.

original: tshe snga yang dge ba byed byed na /
analyzed: tshe snga yang dge ba byed byed na /
translated: If one has done virtuous actions in a previous life,

original: tshe 'dir yang dge ba byed 'dod la /
analyzed: tshe 'dir yang dge ba byed 'dod la /
translated: in this life one will want to do virtuous actions.

original: tshe snga ma la sdig pa byed byed na /
analyzed: tshe snga ma la sdig pa byed byed na /
translated: If one has done nonvirtuous actions in a previous life,

original: tshe 'dir yang sdig pa'i las byed 'dod pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: tshe 'dir yang sdig pa'i las byed 'dod pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: in this life one will want to do nonvirtuous actions. This is the result that is a natural outflow.

original: tshe rabs snga ma la sdig pa mi dge ba byas pas tshe 'dir yang yul khams ngan par skyes pa dang / dge ba byas pas yul bzang por skyes te /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la sdig pa mi dge ba byas pas tshe 'dir yang yul khams ngan par skyes pa dang / dge ba byas pas yul bzang por skyes te /
translated: Because of having done nonvirtuous actions in previous lives, in this life one is born in a bad place, and because of having done virtuous actions, one is born in a good place.

original: yul bzang ngan gyi bdag por skye ba ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //üîΩzhing la so nam byas pas nas mang du @285b rnyed ;
analyzed: yul bzang ngan gyi bdag por skye ba ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o // zhing la so nam byas pas nas mang du @285b rnyed ;
translated: Being born as the ruler of a good or bad place is the dominant result.üîΩBecause of having cultivated a field, one obtains much barley.

original: tshong byas pas zong mang du rnyed /
analyzed: tshong byas pas zong mang du rnyed /
translated: Because of having traded, one obtains much merchandise.

original: rdzi'u byas pas phyugs mang du rnyed pa lta bu ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //

translated: The harm of a lack of Dharma does not occur.

original: kha cig na re zad par gyi skye mched thob pa'i phyir mos pa la dbang ba'o zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: kha cig na re zad par gyi skye mched thob pa'i phyir mos pa la dbang ba'o zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: Some say that mastery of aspiration is due to attaining the bases of mastery.

original: smon lam la dbang ba ni dus nam gyi tshe gang yang rung ba na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gar dga' bar mngon par byang chub par kun du ston par smon lam btab ste /
analyzed: smon lam la dbang ba ni dus nam gyi tshe gang yang rung ba na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gar dga' bar mngon par byang chub par kun du ston par smon lam btab ste /
translated: Mastery of aspiration is the attainment of the power to display manifest enlightenment in any buddha field at any time whatsoever, as one aspires.

original: de ltar smon lam bzhin du ston pa'i dbang thob pas 'dod pa mi 'grub pa'i gnod pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar smon lam bzhin du ston pa'i dbang thob pas 'dod pa mi 'grub pa'i gnod pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since one attains the power to display things in accordance with one's aspiration, there is no harm that can prevent one's wishes from being fulfilled.

original: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zing thams cad du 'bar ba dang 'phul ba la sogs pa kun du ston pas rdzu 'phrul thogs pa med de /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zing thams cad du 'bar ba dang 'phul ba la sogs pa kun du ston pas rdzu 'phrul thogs pa med de /
translated: Mastery of miracles is the unimpeded miracle of displaying the whole of a buddha field blazing with light, flying through space and so forth.

original: skad cig gis kyang gar yang 'gro ba'i phyir chos kun du tshol ba la dbang med pa'i gnod pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skad cig gis kyang gar yang 'gro ba'i phyir chos kun du tshol ba la dbang med pa'i gnod pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since one can go anywhere in an instant, there is no harm that can prevent one from mastering the quest for the Dharma.

original: chos la dbang ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos ma lus par thugs su chud de /
analyzed: chos la dbang ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos ma lus par thugs su chud de /
translated: Mastery of the Dharma is the complete comprehension of all mundane and supramundane, compounded and uncompounded phenomena.

original: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du dbang bsgyur bas chos mi la sogs pa gzhan gyis khrel du dogs pa'i gnod pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du dbang bsgyur bas chos mi la sogs pa gzhan gyis khrel du dogs pa'i gnod pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since he has mastery over the Dharma, he is not harmed by the fear of being ashamed before others.

original: ye shes la dbang ba ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pas gzhan rgol bar dags pa'i gnod pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pas gzhan rgol bar dags pa'i gnod pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since he has mastery over gnosis, he is not harmed by the fear of being defeated by opponents.

original: dbyibs brgyad la /üîΩthung ngu la ltos nas mdung khyim lta bu ni ring po'o //
analyzed: dbyibs brgyad la / thung ngu la ltos nas mdung khyim lta bu ni ring po'o //
translated: Eight kinds of shape:üîΩLong, in relation to short, like a spear.

original: ring po la ltos nas mda' lta bu ni thung ngu'o //üîΩgru bzhi lta bu ni lham pa'o //
analyzed: ring po la ltos nas mda' lta bu ni thung ngu'o // gru bzhi lta bu ni lham pa'o //
translated: Short, in relation to long, like an arrow.üîΩSquare, like a dice.

original: zlum po lta bu ni dkyil 'khor ro //üîΩsa gzhi thag thug med pa lta bu ni mnyam pa'o //üîΩsa gzhi thag thug can lta bu ni mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: zlum po lta bu ni dkyil 'khor ro // sa gzhi thag thug med pa lta bu ni mnyam pa'o // sa gzhi thag thug can lta bu ni mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: Round, like a plate.üîΩEven, like a flat plain.üîΩUneven, like a rugged mountain.

original: de'u @287b dang pog ri lta bu ni sgang ngo /
analyzed: de'u @287b dang pog ri lta bu ni sgang ngo /
translated: High, like a hill.

original: rdzing gi nang lta bu ni gshong ngo //
analyzed: rdzing gi nang lta bu ni gshong ngo //
translated: Low, like a valley.

original: mtshungs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshungs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of equality?

original: dus gsum du gshes pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yon tan mnyam pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dus gsum du gshes pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yon tan mnyam pa lta bu ste /
translated: The qualities of the buddhas of the three times are equal.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i yig 'bru mang du nyung med pa ni yi ge mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i yig 'bru mang du nyung med pa ni yi ge mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The letters of the word buddha are neither more nor less, so they are equal in letters.

original: gsung gi yan lag drug cu dang ldan zhing tshangs pa'i sgra skad lta bu dang ldan par 'dra ba ni gsung mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi yan lag drug cu dang ldan zhing tshangs pa'i sgra skad lta bu dang ldan par 'dra ba ni gsung mtshungs pa'o //
translated: They are equal in speech, for they have the same sixty branches of speech and the same melodious voice of Brahma.

original: chos thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa med cing bdag med pa rnam gnyis su thugs su chud par 'dra ba ni chos mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa med cing bdag med pa rnam gnyis su thugs su chud par 'dra ba ni chos mtshungs pa'o //
translated: They are equal in Dharma, for they are alike in realizing that all phenomena are unborn and unceasing and are devoid of the two kinds of self.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi skur mnyam ste bye brag che chung med pa ni sku mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi skur mnyam ste bye brag che chung med pa ni sku mtshungs pa'o //
translated: All buddhas are equal in their dharmakaya, without any difference in their greatness.

original: bden pa bzhi gcig cing yang bzhi bzhir brtags pa la /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi gcig cing yang bzhi bzhir brtags pa la /
translated: The four noble truths are one, but each is analyzed into four aspects.

original: 'gog pa la ni 'gog pa dang zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la ni 'gog pa dang zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is cessation, peace, excellence and definitive release.

original: lam la ni lam dang / rigs pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: lam la ni lam dang / rigs pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'o //
translated: The path is the path, correct method, accomplishment, and definite release.

original: sdug bsngal la ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'o //
translated: Suffering is impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: kun 'byung la ni rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rkyen dang / 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung la ni rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rkyen dang / 'byung ba'o //
translated: Origination is cause, origination, condition, and appearance.

original: de la 'dod chags dang zhe dang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnams spangs te mi 'byung ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang zhe dang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnams spangs te mi 'byung ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: Abandoning and not producing the afflictions such as desire and hatred and the sinful nonvirtuous actions such as killing is cessation.

original: las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal ci yang mi 'byung ba ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal ci yang mi 'byung ba ni zhi ba'o //
translated: The nonproduction of any suffering that is the result generated by karma and afflictions is peace.

original: phyis kyang khams gsum du skye zhing sdug bsngal myong bar mi 'gyur bas na gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: phyis kyang khams gsum du skye zhing sdug bsngal myong bar mi 'gyur bas na gya nom pa'o //
translated: Since one will not be born again in the three realms and experience suffering, it is sublime.

original: khams gsum btson ra dang 'dra ba nas thar cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bde bar phyin pas na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: khams gsum btson ra dang 'dra ba nas thar cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bde bar phyin pas na 'byung ngo //
translated: Since one is released from the prison of the three realms and arrives at the state of bliss of nirvana, it is definite release.

original: lam ni so so'i skye bo'i sa nas 'phags pa'i gnas su 'gro bas na lam mo //
analyzed: lam ni so so'i skye bo'i sa nas 'phags pa'i gnas su 'gro bas na lam mo //
translated: The path is the path because it goes from the stage of ordinary beings to the stage of noble ones.

original: mi rigs pa nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i gnyen por gyur bas na rigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pa nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i gnyen por gyur bas na rigs pa'o //
translated: It is right because it is the antidote that abandons the afflictions that are wrong.

original: sems phyin ci log spangs te phyin ci ma log par sbyor bas na sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log spangs te phyin ci ma log par sbyor bas na sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is practice because it is applied without error, having abandoned mistaken thoughts.

original: 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang gtan bral zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su phyin par byed pas na nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang gtan bral zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su phyin par byed pas na nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is definite emergence because it causes one to be forever free from the faults of cyclic existence and to reach the state of nirvana.

original: sdug bsngal ni skad cig ma re re las skyes shing 'chi ba'i chos can yin pas na mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni skad cig ma re re las skyes shing 'chi ba'i chos can yin pas na mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Suffering is impermanent because it is produced and subject to death in each moment.

original: sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad kyis rgyun mi 'chad par 'tshe bas na sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad kyis rgyun mi 'chad par 'tshe bas na sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: It is suffering because it is harmed by the three and eight sufferings continuously.

original: phung po lnga'i nang na mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag rtag pa med pas na stong pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i nang na mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag rtag pa med pas na stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty because there is no permanent self imagined by the tƒ´rthikas among the five aggregates.

original: phung po lnga po nyid kyang @288a * //
analyzed: phung po lnga po nyid kyang @288a * //
translated: The five aggregates themselvesüîΩare selfless because they are not under one's own control.

original: mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag rtag pa ma yin pas na bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag rtag pa ma yin pas na bdag med pa'o //
translated: Since the self imputed by the tƒ´rthikas is not permanent, it is selflessness.

original: kun 'byung ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / de las 'phros pa 'jig rten pa'i las dge sdig rnams ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / de las 'phros pa 'jig rten pa'i las dge sdig rnams ni rgyu'o //
translated: The origin is the causes, which are the afflictions such as desire and anger, and the virtuous and nonvirtuous worldly actions that extend from them.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las de dag gis bag chags sems kyi rgyud la sogs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las de dag gis bag chags sems kyi rgyud la sogs te /
translated: Those afflictions and actions are planted as habitual tendencies in the mindstream.

original: khams gsum rgyud lnga'i skye ba'i sa bon du gnas pa ni kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum rgyud lnga'i skye ba'i sa bon du gnas pa ni kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: They remain as the seeds of birth in the three realms and five life-paths, which is the origin.

original: phyi ma'i las dge bas ni dge ba'i bag chags brtas /
analyzed: phyi ma'i las dge bas ni dge ba'i bag chags brtas /
translated: In the future, virtuous actions strengthen the habitual tendencies for virtue.

original: las mi dge bas ni mi dge ba'i bag chags brtas shing 'bras bu smin par byed pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las mi dge bas ni mi dge ba'i bag chags brtas shing 'bras bu smin par byed pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: Nonvirtuous actions strengthen the habitual tendencies for nonvirtue and ripen the results. Those are called the conditions.

original: de ltar rgyu dang rkyen gnyis tshogs te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang rkyen gnyis tshogs te /
translated: Thus, the two, causes and conditions, are a collection.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags so sor brtas nas khams gsum gyi gnas mthon dman du sdug bsngal gyi phung po mngon par bsgrub pa ni 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags so sor brtas nas khams gsum gyi gnas mthon dman du sdug bsngal gyi phung po mngon par bsgrub pa ni 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúarising‚Äù of the aggregates of suffering in the higher and lower realms of the three realms is due to the development of the individual habitual tendencies for virtue and nonvirtue.üîΩThere are five kinds of monks:

original: dge slong rnam pa lnga la long sprang lta bu ni slong ba'i dge slong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong rnam pa lnga la long sprang lta bu ni slong ba'i dge slong ngo //
translated: The ‚Äúbegging monk‚Äù is one who begs for alms.

original: khyim pa'i ming dge slong zhes btags pa lta bu ni ming gi dge slong ngo ;üîΩ/ khrims ma mnos sam /
analyzed: khyim pa'i ming dge slong zhes btags pa lta bu ni ming gi dge slong ngo ; / khrims ma mnos sam /
translated: The ‚Äúnominal monk‚Äù is one who is called a monk but is not a monk.üîΩThe ‚Äúvow-violating monk‚Äù is one who has violated his vows.

original: yang na mnos kyang khrims ral te med par gnas pa ni nga yang dge slong yin no zhes zer bas /üîΩkhas 'ches pa'i dge slong ngo //
analyzed: yang na mnos kyang khrims ral te med par gnas pa ni nga yang dge slong yin no zhes zer bas / khas 'ches pa'i dge slong ngo //
translated: The ‚Äúself-proclaimed monk‚Äù is one who says, ‚ÄúI am a monk,‚Äù even though he has not taken the vows.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon las tshul khrims gtsang mar mnos pa ni gsol ba dang / bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong ngo //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon las tshul khrims gtsang mar mnos pa ni gsol ba dang / bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong ngo //
translated: The ‚Äúfully ordained monk‚Äù is one who has taken the pure vows from a preceptor and an instructor and has been fully ordained by the rite of the four requests.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar du gang zag zung bzhi ya brgyad po rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i dge slong ngo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar du gang zag zung bzhi ya brgyad po rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i dge slong ngo //
translated: The four pairs of persons, i.e., the eight kinds of individual, from the enterer into the stream to the arhat, are the virtuous monks who are free from the defilements.

original: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod chags dang gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / 'gyod pa dang / g-yeng ba dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod chags dang gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / 'gyod pa dang / g-yeng ba dang / the tshom mo //
translated: The five hindrances are: sensual desire, malice, torpor-and-sleep, restlessness-and-worry, and doubt.

original: de dag ci la sgrib ce na /
analyzed: de dag ci la sgrib ce na /
translated: What do they hinder?

original: lhag pa'i bslab pa gsum la sgrib ste /üîΩ'dod pa'i 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i yon tan gtong mi phod da /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bslab pa gsum la sgrib ste / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i yon tan gtong mi phod da /
translated: They hinder the three higher trainings.üîΩSensual desire hinders the higher morality,

original: 'phyo g-yem dang / rku 'phrog la sogs pa byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'phyo g-yem dang / rku 'phrog la sogs pa byed pa yin la /
translated: because one cannot give up the five sense pleasures, and one commits adultery, theft, murder, etc.üîΩMalice hinders the higher morality, because one cannot give up anger and hatred, and one commits many faults such as killing, binding, beating, and so on.

original: gnod sems ni khro zhing zhe sdang gtong mi phod nas srog gcod cing gzhan la 'ching brdeg la sogs pa'i nyes pa mang po byed pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: gnod sems ni khro zhing zhe sdang gtong mi phod nas srog gcod cing gzhan la 'ching brdeg la sogs pa'i nyes pa mang po byed pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sgrib par byed do //
translated: Torpor hinders the higher thought,

original: rmugs pa ni sems blong ste mi gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: rmugs pa ni sems blong ste mi gsal ba yin la /
translated: because one is dull-witted and unclear.

original: gnyid ni sems nang du 'dus nas yul la 'jug pa'i rang dbang med pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gnyid ni sems nang du 'dus nas yul la 'jug pa'i rang dbang med pa yin zhing /
translated: Sleep is the mind's inward withdrawal, the loss of the power to engage objects.

original: 'gyod pa ni legs nyes kyi las ci byas so cog la nyes so bar khu 'phrig za ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni legs nyes kyi las ci byas so cog la nyes so bar khu 'phrig za ste /
translated: Regret is the remorse one feels about any good or bad action one has done.

original: cham la mi @288b phebs pa yin la /
analyzed: cham la mi @288b phebs pa yin la /
translated: It is the inability to be at ease.

original: g-yeng ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'am /
analyzed: g-yeng ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'am /
translated: Distraction is the mind's going out to the five sense objects

original: sngon gyi spyod lam dran pa'i rjes su yan par song ste btang snyoms sam rtse gcig tu 'jog mi nus pas lhag pa'i sems la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: sngon gyi spyod lam dran pa'i rjes su yan par song ste btang snyoms sam rtse gcig tu 'jog mi nus pas lhag pa'i sems la sgrib par byed do //
translated: or to the memory of past behavior, and the inability to rest in equanimity or one-pointedness. It is an obscuration to higher mental states.

original: the tshom ni zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ji lta ba bzhin mi rtogs te /
analyzed: the tshom ni zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ji lta ba bzhin mi rtogs te /
translated: Doubt is the inability to understand the specific and general characteristics of profound and extensive phenomena as they are.

original: lam kha brag tu byung na gar 'gro mi shes pa dang 'dra bas lhag pa'i shes rab la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: lam kha brag tu byung na gar 'gro mi shes pa dang 'dra bas lhag pa'i shes rab la sgrib par byed de /
translated: It is like being at a crossroads not knowing where to go. It is an obscuration to higher wisdom.

original: de ltar bslab pa gsum la sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bslab pa gsum la sgrib pa'o //
translated: Thus, these are the obscurations to the three trainings.

original: zas bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four foods?

original: kham gyi zas dang / reg pa'i zas dang / yid kyi zas dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kham gyi zas dang / reg pa'i zas dang / yid kyi zas dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Food by the mouthful, food by contact, food by volition, and food by consciousness.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dang mi rnams dang / byol song gi rgyud phyugs la sogs pa rnams las phal cher kham gyi zas kyis 'tsho zhing des srog 'dzin pas kham gyi zas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dang mi rnams dang / byol song gi rgyud phyugs la sogs pa rnams las phal cher kham gyi zas kyis 'tsho zhing des srog 'dzin pas kham gyi zas so //
translated: Beings in the desire realm, such as humans and gods, and animals such as cattle, mostly live by food by the mouthful. Since it sustains life, it is called food by the mouthful.

original: bya la sogs pa sgo nga'o cog ni ma'i drod kyis reg pas 'tsho ste /
analyzed: bya la sogs pa sgo nga'o cog ni ma'i drod kyis reg pas 'tsho ste /
translated: Birds and so on live by the warmth of their mother's body.

original: des srog 'dzin pas reg pa'i zas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des srog 'dzin pas reg pa'i zas zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it sustains life, it is called food by contact.

original: rus sbal rgya mtsho na 'dug pa'i bu skam la gzhag pa de ma'i sems ji srid du bu la dran pa de srid du bu'i srog 'dzin pa ni yid kyi zas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rus sbal rgya mtsho na 'dug pa'i bu skam la gzhag pa de ma'i sems ji srid du bu la dran pa de srid du bu'i srog 'dzin pa ni yid kyi zas zhes bya'o //
translated: The life of a turtle living in the ocean is sustained by its mother's mind as long as she remembers her child. This is called food by volition.

original: lo nyes byung ste bzar med nas mas bu rnams la nga don gnyer du 'gro ste slar 'ongs dang phye 'di'i zan sprus te sbyin no zhes brid nas thal ba'i thum bu gcig gdung ma la btags te bzhag nas ma ni thal byung shir song /
analyzed: lo nyes byung ste bzar med nas mas bu rnams la nga don gnyer du 'gro ste slar 'ongs dang phye 'di'i zan sprus te sbyin no zhes brid nas thal ba'i thum bu gcig gdung ma la btags te bzhag nas ma ni thal byung shir song /
